intro: Corydalis pterygopetala var. ecristata, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features slender, creeping stems and trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shaded borders in horticulture.
